text: Primary Colors is a 1998 American comedy-drama movie directed by Mike Nichols. The screenplay by Elaine May was based of the novel Primary Colors: A Novel of Politics about Bill Clinton's first presidential campaign in 1992.Columnist's Mea Culpa: I'm Anonymous , Doreen Carvajal, The New York Times, July 18, 1996 The movie starred John Travolta, Emma Thompson, Billy Bob Thornton, Kathy Bates, Maura Tierney, Larry Hagman, and Adrian Lester. Bates was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her performance, and May was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay. ==References== Category:1998 comedy-drama movies Category:American comedy-drama movies Category:Movies directed by Mike Nichols Category:Movies based on books
title: Primary Colors (movie)
